Dialog.text: Oh my god, is he alive? Please tell me he's alive? Oh my god, I can't have done this.
Dialog.notes: Hysterical. Last part almost to herself.

Dialog.text: No, no, please! You have to tell me something. They said you could fix him, I can't have done this.
You know me, Ken. You know I didn't-
I just need to know he's going to be ok.
You are never around! I was all excited for you to come see this turret with the new sentry software.
Remember how they used to accidentally target those tanks hanging from the guylines? Fixed!
He's extra smart so, guess who I named him after? Hit me up when you have a minute.
This is Joan Winslow, personal diary, install day two. Working out kinks. Version three point two seven.
Sentry software has been patched. Diagnostics look good. Previous flaws in targeting seem to be gone.
I've retired Jean and Mae Capone, but Helen, Karen, Opal and Bonnie Parker all got the upgrade.
[sound of tools clanking, air hoses hissing]
Dialog.notes: SFX, dropping tools, disconnecting air compressors.

Dialog.text: I think this new one here is going to break convention. I'm going to call him Brian.
Ok, yeah. Let me just turn this off.
